intro: Bignonia patellifera, commonly known as the Mexican crossvine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a deciduous climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves and is often found growing in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Bignonia patellifera is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in landscaping for its vibrant floral display.
